snippet: Thomas F. Prendergast is the governor’s nominee to be chairman and chief executive of the Metropolitan Transit Authority, succeeding Joseph J. Lhota, who resigned to run for mayor.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo nominates Thomas F Prendergast to serve as chairman and chief executive of Metropolitan Transportation Authority; Prendergast is veteran transit executive who has been authority's interim executive director since Joseph J Lhota's departure.
lead_paragraph: Thomas F. Prendergast is the governor’s nominee to be chairman and chief executive of the Metropolitan Transit Authority, succeeding Joseph J. Lhota, who resigned to run for mayor.

headline.seo: Thomas Prendergast Is Picked to be M.T.A. Chairman
headline.main: Interim M.T.A. Leader Picked to Be Its Chief
headline.print_headline: Interim M.T.A. Leader Picked to Be Its Chief
